00031 /*
00032  * About the verification for striped directory. Some rules and assumptions:
00033  *
00034  * 1) lmv_magic: The magic may be wrong. But it is almost impossible (1/2^32
00035  *    probability) that a master LMV EA claims as a slave LMV EA by wrong,
00036  *    so we can ignore such race case and the reverse case.
00037  *
00038  * 2) lmv_master_mdt_index: The master index can be self-verified by compared
00039  *    with the MDT index directly. The slave stripe index can be verified by
00040  *    compared with the file name. Although both the name entry and the LMV EA
00041  *    can be wrong, it is almost impossible that they hit the same bad data
00042  *    So if they match each other, then trust them. Similarly, for the shard,
00043  *    it stores index in both slave LMV EA and in linkEA, if the two copies
00044  *    match, then trust them.
00045  *
00046  * 3) lmv_hash_type: The valid hash type should be LMV_HASH_TYPE_ALL_CHARS or
00047  *    LMV_HASH_TYPE_FNV_1A_64. If the LFSCK instance on some slave finds that
00048  *    the name hash against the hash function does not match the MDT, then it
00049  *    will change the master LMV EA hash type as LMV_HASH_TYPE_UNKNOWN. With
00050  *    such hash type, the whole striped directory still can be accessed via
00051  *    lookup/readdir, and also support unlink, but cannot add new name entry.
00052  *
00053  * 3.1) If the master hash type is one of the valid values, then trust the
00054  *      master LMV EA. Because:
00055  *
00056  * 3.1.1) The master hash type is visible to the client and used by the client.
00057  *
00058  * 3.1.2) For a given name, different hash types may map the name entry to the
00059  *        same MDT. So simply checking one name entry or some name entries may
00060  *        cannot verify whether the hash type is correct or not.
00061  *
00062  * 3.1.3) Different shards can claim different hash types, it is not easy to
00063  *        distinguish which ones are correct. Even though the master is wrong,
00064  *        as the LFSCK processing, some LFSCK instance on other MDT may finds
00065  *        unmatched name hash, then it will change the master hash type to
00066  *        LMV_HASH_TYPE_UNKNOWN as described above. The worst case is euqal
00067  *        to the case without the LFSCK.
00068  *
00069  * 3.2) If the master hash type is invalid, nor LMV_HASH_TYPE_UNKNOWN, then
00070  *      trust the first shard with valid hash type (ALL_CHARS or FNV_1A_64).
00071  *      If the shard is also worng, means there are double failures, then as
00072  *      the LFSCK processing, other LFSCK instances on the other MDTs may
00073  *      find unmatched name hash, and then, the master hash type will be
00074  *      changed to LMV_HASH_TYPE_UNKNOWN as described in the 3).
00075  *
00076  * 3.3) If the master hash type is LMV_HASH_TYPE_UNKNOWN, then it is possible
00077  *      that some other LFSCK instance on other MDT found bad name hash, then
00078  *      changed the master hash type to LMV_HASH_TYPE_UNKNOWN as described in
00079  *      the 3). But it also maybe because of data corruption in master LMV EA.
00080  *      To make such two cases to be distinguishable, when the LFSCK changes
00081  *      the master hash type to LMV_HASH_TYPE_UNKNOWN, it will mark in the
00082  *      master LMV EA (new lmv flags LMV_HASH_FLAG_BAD_TYPE). Then subsequent
00083  *      LFSCK checking can distinguish them: for former case, turst the master
00084  *      LMV EA with nothing to be done; otherwise, trust the first shard with
00085  *      valid hash type (ALL_CHARS or FNV_1A_64) as the 3.2) does.
00086  *
00087  * 4) lmv_stripe_count: For a shard of a striped directory, if its index has
00088  *    been verified as the 2), then the stripe count must be larger than its
00089  *    index. For the master object, by scanning each shard's index, the LFSCK
00090  *    can know the highest index, and the stripe count must be larger than the
00091  *    known highest index. If the stipe count in the LMV EA matches above two
00092  *    rules, then it is may be trustable. If both the master claimed stripe
00093  *    count and the slave claimed stripe count match each own rule, but they
00094  *    are not the same, then trust the master. Because the stripe count in
00095  *    the master LMV EA is visible to client and used to distribute the name
00096  *    entry to some shard, but the slave LMV EA is only used for verification
00097  *    and invisible to client.
00098  *
00099  * 5) If the master LMV EA is lost, then there are two possible cases:
00100  *
00101  * 5.1) The slave claims slave LMV EA by wrong, means that the parent was not
00102  *      a striped directory, but its sub-directory has a wrong slave LMV EA.
00103  *      It is very very race case, similar as the 1), can be ignored.
00104  *
00105  * 5.2) The parent directory is a striped directory, but the master LMV EA
00106  *      is lost or crashed. Then the LFSCK needs to re-generate the master
00107  *      LMV EA: the lmv_master_mdt_index is from the MDT device index; the
00108  *      lmv_hash_type is from the first valid shard; the lmv_stripe_count
00109  *      will be calculated via scanning all the shards.
00110  *
00111  * 5.2.1) Before re-generating the master LMV EA, the LFSCK needs to check
00112  *        whether someone has created some file(s) under the master object
00113  *        after the master LMV EA disappear. If yes, the LFSCK will cannot
00114  *        re-generate the master LMV EA, otherwise, such new created files
00115  *        will be invisible to client. Under such case, the LFSCK will mark
00116  *        the master object as read only (without master LMV EA). Then all
00117  *        things under the master MDT-object, including those new created
00118  *        files and the shards themselves, will be visibile to client. And
00119  *        then the administrator can handle the bad striped directory with
00120  *        more human knowledge.
00121  *
00122  * 5.2.2) If someone created some special sub-directory under the master
00123  *        MDT-object with the same naming rule as shard name $FID:$index,
00124  *        as to the LFSCK cannot detect it before re-generating the master
00125  *        LMV EA, then such sub-directory itself will be invisible after
00126  *        the LFSCK re-generating the master LMV EA. The sub-items under
00127  *        such sub-directory are still visible to client. As the LFSCK
00128  *        processing, if such sub-directory cause some conflict with other
00129  *        normal shard, such as the index conflict, then the LFSCK will
00130  *        remove the master LMV EA and change the master MDT-object to
00131  *        read-only mode as the 5.2.1). But if there is no conflict, the
00132  *        LFSCK will regard such sub-directory as a striped shard that
00133  *        lost its slave LMV EA, and will re-generate slave LMV EA for it.
00134  *
00135  * 5.2.3) Anytime, if the LFSCK found some shards name/index conflict,
00136  *        and cannot make the distinguish which one is right, then it
00137  *        will remove the master LMV EA and change the MDT-object to
00138  *        read-only mode as the 5.2.2).
00139  */
00140

00155 void lfsck_lmv_put(const struct lu_env *env, struct lfsck_lmv *llmv)
00156 {
00157         if (llmv != NULL && atomic_dec_and_test(&llmv->ll_ref)) {
00158                 if (llmv->ll_inline) {
00159                         struct lfsck_lmv_unit   *llu;
00160                         struct lfsck_instance   *lfsck;
00161 
00162                         llu = list_entry(llmv, struct lfsck_lmv_unit, llu_lmv);
00163                         lfsck = llu->llu_lfsck;
00164 
00165                         spin_lock(&lfsck->li_lock);
00166                         list_del(&llu->llu_link);
00167                         spin_unlock(&lfsck->li_lock);
00168 
00169                         lfsck_object_put(env, llu->llu_obj);
00170 
00171                         LASSERT(llmv->ll_lslr != NULL);
00172 
00173                         OBD_FREE_LARGE(llmv->ll_lslr,
00174                                        sizeof(*llmv->ll_lslr) *
00175                                        llmv->ll_stripes_allocated);
00176                         OBD_FREE_PTR(llu);
00177                 } else {
00178                         if (llmv->ll_lslr != NULL)
00179                                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(llmv->ll_lslr,
00180                                         sizeof(*llmv->ll_lslr) *
00181                                         llmv->ll_stripes_allocated);
00182 
00183                         OBD_FREE_PTR(llmv);
00184                 }
00185         }
00186 }
00187 
00202 static int lfsck_disable_master_lmv(const struct lu_env *env,
00203                                     struct lfsck_component *com,
00204                                     struct dt_object *obj, bool del_lmv)
00205 {
00206         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
00207         struct lu_attr                  *la     = &info->lti_la;
00208         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
00209         struct dt_device                *dev    = lfsck_obj2dev(obj);
00210         struct thandle                  *th     = NULL;
00211         int                              rc     = 0;
00212         ENTRY;
00213 
00214         th = dt_trans_create(env, dev);
00215         if (IS_ERR(th))
00216                 GOTO(log, rc = PTR_ERR(th));
00217 
00218         if (del_lmv) {
00219                 rc = dt_declare_xattr_del(env, obj, XATTR_NAME_LMV, th);
00220                 if (rc != 0)
00221                         GOTO(stop, rc);
00222         }
00223 
00224         la->la_valid = LA_FLAGS;
00225         rc = dt_declare_attr_set(env, obj, la, th);
00226         if (rc != 0)
00227                 GOTO(stop, rc);
00228 
00229         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dev, th);
00230         if (rc != 0)
00231                 GOTO(stop, rc);
00232 
00233         dt_write_lock(env, obj, 0);
00234         if (unlikely(lfsck_is_dead_obj(obj)))
00235                 GOTO(unlock, rc = 1);
00236 
00237         if (lfsck->li_bookmark_ram.lb_param & LPF_DRYRUN)
00238                 GOTO(unlock, rc = 0);
00239 
00240         if (del_lmv) {
00241                 rc = dt_xattr_del(env, obj, XATTR_NAME_LMV, th);
00242                 if (rc != 0)
00243                         GOTO(unlock, rc);
00244         }
00245 
00246         rc = dt_attr_get(env, obj, la);
00247         if (rc == 0 && !(la->la_flags & LUSTRE_IMMUTABLE_FL)) {
00248                 la->la_valid = LA_FLAGS;
00249                 la->la_flags |= LUSTRE_IMMUTABLE_FL;
00250                 rc = dt_attr_set(env, obj, la, th);
00251         }
00252 
00253         GOTO(unlock, rc);
00254 
00255 unlock:
00256         dt_write_unlock(env, obj);
00257 
00258 stop:
00259         dt_trans_stop(env, dev, th);
00260 
00261 log:
00262         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: namespace LFSCK set the master MDT-object of "
00263                "the striped directory "DFID" as read-only: rc = %d\n",
00264                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(obj)), rc);
00265 
00266         if (rc <= 0) {
00267                 struct lfsck_namespace *ns = com->lc_file_ram;
00268 
00269                 ns->ln_flags |= LF_INCONSISTENT;
00270                 if (rc == 0)
00271                         ns->ln_striped_dirs_disabled++;
00272         }
00273 
00274         return rc;
00275 }
00276 
00277 static inline bool lfsck_is_valid_slave_lmv(struct lmv_mds_md_v1 *lmv)
00278 {
00279         return lmv->lmv_stripe_count >= 1 &&
00280                lmv->lmv_stripe_count <= LFSCK_LMV_MAX_STRIPES &&
00281                lmv->lmv_stripe_count > lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index &&
00282                lmv_is_known_hash_type(lmv->lmv_hash_type);
00283 }
00284 
00301 static int lfsck_remove_lmv(const struct lu_env *env,
00302                             struct lfsck_component *com,
00303                             struct dt_object *obj,
00304                             struct lfsck_namespace_req *lnr)
00305 {
00306         struct lustre_handle     lh     = { 0 };
00307         int                      rc;
00308 
00309         lnr->lnr_lmv->ll_ignore = 1;
00310         rc = lfsck_ibits_lock(env, com->lc_lfsck, obj, &lh,
00311                               MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE | MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR,
00312                               LCK_EX);
00313         if (rc == 0) {
00314                 rc = lfsck_disable_master_lmv(env, com, obj, true);
00315                 lfsck_ibits_unlock(&lh, LCK_EX);
00316         }
00317 
00318         return rc;
00319 }
00320 
00334 static int lfsck_remove_dirent(const struct lu_env *env,
00335                                struct lfsck_component *com,
00336                                struct dt_object *dir,
00337                                const struct lu_fid *fid, __u32 index)
00338 {
00339         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info = lfsck_env_info(env);
00340         struct dt_object                *obj;
00341         int                              rc;
00342 
00343         snprintf(info->lti_tmpbuf2, sizeof(info->lti_tmpbuf2), DFID":%u",
00344                  PFID(fid), index);
00345         obj = lfsck_object_find_bottom(env, com->lc_lfsck, fid);
00346         if (IS_ERR(obj))
00347                 return PTR_ERR(obj);
00348 
00349         rc = lfsck_namespace_repair_dirent(env, com, dir, obj,
00350                                         info->lti_tmpbuf2, info->lti_tmpbuf2,
00351                                         S_IFDIR, false, false);
00352         lfsck_object_put(env, obj);
00353         if (rc > 0) {
00354                 struct lfsck_namespace *ns = com->lc_file_ram;
00355 
00356                 ns->ln_dirent_repaired++;
00357         }
00358 
00359         return rc;
00360 }
00361 
00385 static int lfsck_replace_lmv(const struct lu_env *env,
00386                              struct lfsck_component *com,
00387                              struct dt_object *dir,
00388                              struct lfsck_slave_lmv_rec *lslr,
00389                              struct lfsck_namespace_req *lnr,
00390                              struct lmv_mds_md_v1 *lmv,
00391                              __u32 index, __u32 flags)
00392 {
00393         struct lfsck_lmv *llmv = lnr->lnr_lmv;
00394         int               rc;
00395 
00396         rc = lfsck_remove_dirent(env, com, dir,
00397                                  &lslr->lslr_fid, index);
00398         if (rc < 0)
00399                 return rc;
00400 
00401         lslr->lslr_fid = lnr->lnr_fid;
00402         lslr->lslr_flags = flags;
00403         lslr->lslr_stripe_count = lmv->lmv_stripe_count;
00404         lslr->lslr_index = lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index;
00405         lslr->lslr_hash_type = lmv->lmv_hash_type;
00406         if (flags == LSLF_NONE) {
00407                 if (llmv->ll_hash_type == LMV_HASH_TYPE_UNKNOWN &&
00408                     lmv_is_known_hash_type(lmv->lmv_hash_type))
00409                         llmv->ll_hash_type = lmv->lmv_hash_type;
00410 
00411                 if (lslr->lslr_stripe_count <= LFSCK_LMV_MAX_STRIPES &&
00412                     llmv->ll_max_stripe_count < lslr->lslr_stripe_count)
00413                         llmv->ll_max_stripe_count = lslr->lslr_stripe_count;
00414         }
00415 
00416         return 0;
00417 }
00418 
00485 static int lfsck_record_lmv(const struct lu_env *env,
00486                             struct lfsck_component *com,
00487                             struct dt_object *dir,
00488                             struct lfsck_namespace_req *lnr,
00489                             struct lmv_mds_md_v1 *lmv, __u32 shard_idx,
00490                             __u32 flags, __u32 flags2, __u32 *depth)
00491 {
00492         struct lfsck_instance      *lfsck = com->lc_lfsck;
00493         struct lfsck_lmv           *llmv  = lnr->lnr_lmv;
00494         const struct lu_fid        *fid   = &lnr->lnr_fid;
00495         struct lfsck_slave_lmv_rec *lslr;
00496         struct lfsck_rec_lmv_save  *lrls;
00497         int                         index = shard_idx;
00498         int                         rc    = 0;
00499         ENTRY;
00500 
00501         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: record slave LMV EA for the striped directory "
00502                DFID": shard = "DFID", index = %u, flags = %u, flags2 = %u, "
00503                "depth = %d\n", lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck),
00504                PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(dir)), PFID(fid),
00505                index, flags, flags2, *depth);
00506 
00507         if (index < 0 || index >= LFSCK_LMV_MAX_STRIPES)
00508                 RETURN(-ERANGE);
00509 
00510         if (index >= llmv->ll_stripes_allocated) {
00511                 struct lfsck_slave_lmv_rec *new_lslr;
00512                 int new_stripes = index + 1;
00513                 size_t old_size = sizeof(*lslr) * llmv->ll_stripes_allocated;
00514 
00515                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(new_lslr, sizeof(*new_lslr) * new_stripes);
00516                 if (new_lslr == NULL) {
00517                         llmv->ll_failed = 1;
00518 
00519                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00520                 }
00521 
00522                 memcpy(new_lslr, llmv->ll_lslr, old_size);
00523                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(llmv->ll_lslr, old_size);
00524                 llmv->ll_stripes_allocated = new_stripes;
00525                 llmv->ll_lslr = new_lslr;
00526         }
00527 
00528         lslr = llmv->ll_lslr + index;
00529         if (unlikely(lu_fid_eq(&lslr->lslr_fid, fid)))
00530                 RETURN(0);
00531 
00532         if (fid_is_zero(&lslr->lslr_fid)) {
00533                 lslr->lslr_fid = *fid;
00534                 lslr->lslr_stripe_count = lmv->lmv_stripe_count;
00535                 lslr->lslr_index = lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index;
00536                 lslr->lslr_hash_type = lmv->lmv_hash_type;
00537                 lslr->lslr_flags = flags;
00538                 llmv->ll_stripes_filled++;
00539                 if (flags == LSLF_NONE) {
00540                         if (llmv->ll_hash_type == LMV_HASH_TYPE_UNKNOWN &&
00541                             lmv_is_known_hash_type(lmv->lmv_hash_type))
00542                                 llmv->ll_hash_type = lmv->lmv_hash_type;
00543 
00544                         if (lslr->lslr_stripe_count <= LFSCK_LMV_MAX_STRIPES &&
00545                             llmv->ll_max_stripe_count < lslr->lslr_stripe_count)
00546                                 llmv->ll_max_stripe_count =
00547                                                         lslr->lslr_stripe_count;
00548                 }
00549 
00550                 if (llmv->ll_max_filled_off < index)
00551                         llmv->ll_max_filled_off = index;
00552 
00553                 RETURN(0);
00554         }
00555 
00556         (*depth)++;
00557         if (flags != LSLF_BAD_INDEX2)
00558                 LASSERTF(*depth == 1, "depth = %d\n", *depth);
00559 
00560         /* Handle conflict cases. */
00561         switch (lslr->lslr_flags) {
00562         case LSLF_NONE:
00563         case LSLF_BAD_INDEX2:
00564                 /* The existing one is a normal valid object. */
00565                 switch (flags) {
00566                 case LSLF_NONE:
00567                         /* The two 'valid' name entries claims the same
00568                          * index, the LFSCK cannot distinguish which one
00569                          * is correct. Then remove the master LMV EA to
00570                          * make all shards to be visible to client, and
00571                          * mark the master MDT-object as read-only. The
00572                          * administrator can handle the conflict with
00573                          * more human knowledge. */
00574                         rc = lfsck_remove_lmv(env, com, dir, lnr);
00575                         break;
00576                 case LSLF_BAD_INDEX2:
00577                         GOTO(out, rc = -EEXIST);
00578                 case LSLF_NO_LMVEA:
00579 
00580 no_lmvea:
00581                         if (llmv->ll_lmv.lmv_hash_type &
00582                             LMV_HASH_FLAG_LOST_LMV) {
00583                                 /* If the master LMV EA was re-generated
00584                                  * by the former LFSCK reparation, and
00585                                  * before such reparation, someone has
00586                                  * created the conflict object, but the
00587                                  * LFSCK did not detect such conflict,
00588                                  * then we have to remove the master
00589                                  * LMV EA and mark the master MDT-object
00590                                  * as read-only. The administrator can
00591                                  * handle the conflict with more human
00592                                  * knowledge. */
00593                                 rc = lfsck_remove_lmv(env, com, dir, lnr);
00594                         } else {
00595                                 /* Otherwise, remove the current name entry,
00596                                  * and add its FID in the LFSCK tracing file
00597                                  * for further processing. */
00598                                 rc = lfsck_namespace_trace_update(env, com, fid,
00599                                                 LNTF_CHECK_PARENT, true);
00600                                 if (rc == 0)
00601                                         rc = lfsck_remove_dirent(env, com, dir,
00602                                                                  fid, index);
00603                         }
00604 
00605                         break;
00606                 case LSLF_DANGLING:
00607                         /* Remove the current dangling name entry. */
00608                         rc = lfsck_remove_dirent(env, com, dir, fid, index);
00609                         break;
00610                 case LSLF_BAD_INDEX1:
00611                         index = lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index;
00612                         lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index = shard_idx;
00613                         /* The name entry claims an index that is conflict
00614                          * with a valid existing name entry, then try the
00615                          * index in the lmv recursively. */
00616                         rc = lfsck_record_lmv(env, com, dir, lnr, lmv, index,
00617                                 LSLF_BAD_INDEX2, lslr->lslr_flags, depth);
00618                         lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index = index;
00619                         if (rc == -ERANGE || rc == -EEXIST)
00620                                 /* The index in the lmv is invalid or
00621                                  * also conflict with other. Then we do
00622                                  * not know how to resolve the conflict.
00623                                  * We will handle it as handle the case
00624                                  * of 'LSLF_NONE' vs 'LSLF_NONE'. */
00625                                 rc = lfsck_remove_lmv(env, com, dir, lnr);
00626 
00627                         break;
00628                 default:
00629                         break;
00630                 }
00631 
00632                 break;
00633         case LSLF_NO_LMVEA:
00634                 /* The existing one has no slave LMV EA. */
00635                 switch (flags) {
00636                 case LSLF_NONE:
00637 
00638 none:
00639                         if (llmv->ll_lmv.lmv_hash_type &
00640                             LMV_HASH_FLAG_LOST_LMV) {
00641                                 /* If the master LMV EA was re-generated
00642                                  * by the former LFSCK reparation, and
00643                                  * before such reparation, someone has
00644                                  * created the conflict object, but the
00645                                  * LFSCK did not detect such conflict,
00646                                  * then we have to remove the master
00647                                  * LMV EA and mark the master MDT-object
00648                                  * as read-only. The administrator can
00649                                  * handle the conflict with more human
00650                                  * knowledge. */
00651                                 rc = lfsck_remove_lmv(env, com, dir, lnr);
00652                         } else {
00653                                 lrls = &lfsck->li_rec_lmv_save[*depth - 1];
00654                                 lrls->lrls_fid = lslr->lslr_fid;
00655                                 /* Otherwise, remove the existing name entry,
00656                                  * and add its FID in the LFSCK tracing file
00657                                  * for further processing. Refill the slot
00658                                  * with current slave LMV EA. */
00659                                 rc = lfsck_namespace_trace_update(env,
00660                                                 com, &lrls->lrls_fid,
00661                                                 LNTF_CHECK_PARENT, true);
00662                                 if (rc == 0)
00663                                         rc = lfsck_replace_lmv(env, com, dir,
00664                                                 lslr, lnr, lmv, index, flags);
00665                         }
00666 
00667                         break;
00668                 case LSLF_BAD_INDEX2:
00669                         if (flags2 >= lslr->lslr_flags)
00670                                 GOTO(out, rc = -EEXIST);
00671 
00672                         goto none;
00673                 case LSLF_NO_LMVEA:
00674                         goto no_lmvea;
00675                 case LSLF_DANGLING:
00676                         /* Remove the current dangling name entry. */
00677                         rc = lfsck_remove_dirent(env, com, dir, fid, index);
00678                         break;
00679                 case LSLF_BAD_INDEX1:
00680                         index = lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index;
00681                         lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index = shard_idx;
00682                         /* The name entry claims an index that is conflict
00683                          * with a valid existing name entry, then try the
00684                          * index in the lmv recursively. */
00685                         rc = lfsck_record_lmv(env, com, dir, lnr, lmv, index,
00686                                 LSLF_BAD_INDEX2, lslr->lslr_flags, depth);
00687                         lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index = index;
00688                         if (rc == -ERANGE || rc == -EEXIST) {
00689                                 index = shard_idx;
00690                                 goto no_lmvea;
00691                         }
00692 
00693                         break;
00694                 default:
00695                         break;
00696                 }
00697 
00698                 break;
00699         case LSLF_DANGLING:
00700                 /* The existing one is a dangling name entry. */
00701                 switch (flags) {
00702                 case LSLF_NONE:
00703                 case LSLF_BAD_INDEX2:
00704                 case LSLF_NO_LMVEA:
00705                         /* Remove the existing dangling name entry.
00706                          * Refill the lslr slot with the given LMV. */
00707                         rc = lfsck_replace_lmv(env, com, dir, lslr, lnr,
00708                                                lmv, index, flags);
00709                         break;
00710                 case LSLF_DANGLING:
00711                         /* Two dangling name entries conflict,
00712                          * remove the current one. */
00713                         rc = lfsck_remove_dirent(env, com, dir, fid, index);
00714                         break;
00715                 case LSLF_BAD_INDEX1:
00716                         index = lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index;
00717                         lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index = shard_idx;
00718                         /* The name entry claims an index that is conflict
00719                          * with a valid existing name entry, then try the
00720                          * index in the lmv recursively. */
00721                         rc = lfsck_record_lmv(env, com, dir, lnr, lmv, index,
00722                                 LSLF_BAD_INDEX2, lslr->lslr_flags, depth);
00723                         lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index = index;
00724                         if (rc == -ERANGE || rc == -EEXIST)
00725                                 /* If the index in the lmv is invalid or
00726                                  * also conflict with other, then remove
00727                                  * the existing dangling name entry.
00728                                  * Refill the lslr slot with the given LMV. */
00729                                 rc = lfsck_replace_lmv(env, com, dir, lslr, lnr,
00730                                                        lmv, shard_idx, flags);
00731 
00732                         break;
00733                 default:
00734                         break;
00735                 }
00736 
00737                 break;
00738         case LSLF_BAD_INDEX1: {
00739                 if (*depth >= LFSCK_REC_LMV_MAX_DEPTH)
00740                         goto conflict;
00741 
00742                 lrls = &lfsck->li_rec_lmv_save[*depth - 1];
00743                 lrls->lrls_fid = lnr->lnr_fid;
00744                 lrls->lrls_lmv = *lmv;
00745 
00746                 lnr->lnr_fid = lslr->lslr_fid;
00747                 lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index = index;
00748                 lmv->lmv_stripe_count = lslr->lslr_stripe_count;
00749                 lmv->lmv_hash_type = lslr->lslr_hash_type;
00750                 index = lslr->lslr_index;
00751 
00752                 /* The existing one has another possible slot,
00753                  * try it recursively. */
00754                 rc = lfsck_record_lmv(env, com, dir, lnr, lmv, index,
00755                                       LSLF_BAD_INDEX2, flags, depth);
00756                 *lmv = lrls->lrls_lmv;
00757                 lnr->lnr_fid = lrls->lrls_fid;
00758                 index = shard_idx;
00759                 if (rc != 0) {
00760                         if (rc == -ERANGE || rc == -EEXIST)
00761                                 goto conflict;
00762 
00763                         break;
00764                 }
00765 
00766                 lslr->lslr_fid = *fid;
00767                 lslr->lslr_flags = flags;
00768                 lslr->lslr_stripe_count = lmv->lmv_stripe_count;
00769                 lslr->lslr_index = lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index;
00770                 lslr->lslr_hash_type = lmv->lmv_hash_type;
00771                 if (flags == LSLF_NONE) {
00772                         if (llmv->ll_hash_type == LMV_HASH_TYPE_UNKNOWN &&
00773                             lmv_is_known_hash_type(lmv->lmv_hash_type))
00774                                 llmv->ll_hash_type = lmv->lmv_hash_type;
00775 
00776                         if (lslr->lslr_stripe_count <= LFSCK_LMV_MAX_STRIPES &&
00777                             llmv->ll_max_stripe_count < lslr->lslr_stripe_count)
00778                                 llmv->ll_max_stripe_count =
00779                                                         lslr->lslr_stripe_count;
00780                 }
00781 
00782                 break;
00783 
00784 conflict:
00785                 switch (flags) {
00786                 case LSLF_NONE:
00787                         /* The two 'valid' name entries claims the same
00788                          * index, the LFSCK cannot distinguish which one
00789                          * is correct. Then remove the master LMV EA to
00790                          * make all shards to be visible to client, and
00791                          * mark the master MDT-object as read-only. The
00792                          * administrator can handle the conflict with
00793                          * more human knowledge. */
00794                         rc = lfsck_remove_lmv(env, com, dir, lnr);
00795                         break;
00796                 case LSLF_BAD_INDEX2:
00797                         GOTO(out, rc = -EEXIST);
00798                 case LSLF_NO_LMVEA:
00799                         goto no_lmvea;
00800                 case LSLF_DANGLING:
00801                         /* Remove the current dangling name entry. */
00802                         rc = lfsck_remove_dirent(env, com, dir, fid, index);
00803                         break;
00804                 case LSLF_BAD_INDEX1:
00805                         index = lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index;
00806                         lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index = shard_idx;
00807                         /* The name entry claims an index that is conflict
00808                          * with a valid existing name entry, then try the
00809                          * index in the lmv recursively. */
00810                         rc = lfsck_record_lmv(env, com, dir, lnr, lmv, index,
00811                                 LSLF_BAD_INDEX2, lslr->lslr_flags, depth);
00812                         lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index = index;
00813                         if (rc == -ERANGE || rc == -EEXIST)
00814                                 /* The index in the lmv is invalid or
00815                                  * also conflict with other. Then we do
00816                                  * not know how to resolve the conflict.
00817                                  * We will handle it as handle the case
00818                                  * of 'LSLF_NONE' vs 'LSLF_NONE'. */
00819                                 rc = lfsck_remove_lmv(env, com, dir, lnr);
00820 
00821                         break;
00822                 }
00823 
00824                 break;
00825         }
00826         default:
00827                 break;
00828         }
00829 
00830         if (rc < 0)
00831                 llmv->ll_failed = 1;
00832 
00833         GOTO(out, rc);
00834 
00835 out:
00836         (*depth)--;
00837 
00838         return rc > 0 ? 0 : rc;
00839 }
00840 
00841 int lfsck_read_stripe_lmv(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *obj,
00842                           struct lmv_mds_md_v1 *lmv)
00843 {
00844         int rc;
00845 
00846         dt_read_lock(env, obj, 0);
00847         rc = dt_xattr_get(env, obj, lfsck_buf_get(env, lmv, sizeof(*lmv)),
00848                           XATTR_NAME_LMV);
00849         dt_read_unlock(env, obj);
00850         if (rc != sizeof(*lmv))
00851                 return rc > 0 ? -EINVAL : rc;
00852 
00853         lfsck_lmv_header_le_to_cpu(lmv, lmv);
00854         if ((lmv->lmv_magic == LMV_MAGIC &&
00855              !(lmv->lmv_hash_type & LMV_HASH_FLAG_MIGRATION)) ||
00856             (lmv->lmv_magic == LMV_MAGIC_STRIPE &&
00857              !(lmv->lmv_hash_type & LMV_HASH_FLAG_DEAD)))
00858                 return 0;
00859 
00860         return -ENODATA;
00861 }
00862 
00880 int lfsck_shard_name_to_index(const struct lu_env *env, const char *name,
00881                               int namelen, __u16 type, const struct lu_fid *fid)
00882 {
00883         char    *name2  = lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_tmpbuf2;
00884         int      len;
00885         int      idx    = 0;
00886 
00887         if (!S_ISDIR(type))
00888                 return -ENOTDIR;
00889 
00890         LASSERT(name != name2);
00891 
00892         len = snprintf(name2, sizeof(lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_tmpbuf2),
00893                        DFID":", PFID(fid));
00894         if (namelen < len + 1 || memcmp(name, name2, len) != 0)
00895                 return -EINVAL;
00896 
00897         do {
00898                 if (!isdigit(name[len]))
00899                         return -EINVAL;
00900 
00901                 idx = idx * 10 + name[len++] - '0';
00902         } while (len < namelen);
00903 
00904         if (idx >= LFSCK_LMV_MAX_STRIPES)
00905                 return -EINVAL;
00906 
00907         return idx;
00908 }
00909 
00910 bool lfsck_is_valid_slave_name_entry(const struct lu_env *env,
00911                                      struct lfsck_lmv *llmv,
00912                                      const char *name, int namelen)
00913 {
00914         struct lmv_mds_md_v1    *lmv;
00915         int                      idx;
00916 
00917         if (llmv == NULL || !llmv->ll_lmv_slave || !llmv->ll_lmv_verified)
00918                 return true;
00919 
00920         lmv = &llmv->ll_lmv;
00921         idx = lmv_name_to_stripe_index(lmv->lmv_hash_type,
00922                                        lmv->lmv_stripe_count,
00923                                        name, namelen);
00924         if (unlikely(idx != lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index))
00925                 return false;
00926 
00927         return true;
00928 }
00929 
00948 int lfsck_namespace_check_name(const struct lu_env *env,
00949                                struct dt_object *parent,
00950                                struct dt_object *child,
00951                                const struct lu_name *cname)
00952 {
00953         struct lmv_mds_md_v1    *lmv = &lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_lmv;
00954         int                      idx;
00955         int                      rc;
00956 
00957         rc = lfsck_read_stripe_lmv(env, parent, lmv);
00958         if (rc != 0)
00959                 RETURN(rc == -ENODATA ? 0 : rc);
00960 
00961         if (lmv->lmv_magic == LMV_MAGIC_STRIPE) {
00962                 if (!lfsck_is_valid_slave_lmv(lmv))
00963                         return 0;
00964 
00965                 idx = lmv_name_to_stripe_index(lmv->lmv_hash_type,
00966                                                lmv->lmv_stripe_count,
00967                                                cname->ln_name,
00968                                                cname->ln_namelen);
00969                 if (unlikely(idx != lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index))
00970                         return 1;
00971         } else if (lfsck_shard_name_to_index(env, cname->ln_name,
00972                         cname->ln_namelen, lfsck_object_type(child),
00973                         lfsck_dto2fid(child)) < 0) {
00974                 return 1;
00975         }
00976 
00977         return 0;
00978 }
00979 
00993 int lfsck_namespace_update_lmv(const struct lu_env *env,
00994                                struct lfsck_component *com,
00995                                struct dt_object *obj,
00996                                struct lmv_mds_md_v1 *lmv, bool locked)
00997 {
00998         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
00999         struct lmv_mds_md_v1            *lmv4   = &info->lti_lmv4;
01000         struct lu_buf                   *buf    = &info->lti_buf;
01001         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
01002         struct dt_device                *dev    = lfsck_obj2dev(obj);
01003         struct thandle                  *th     = NULL;
01004         struct lustre_handle             lh     = { 0 };
01005         int                              rc     = 0;
01006         int                              rc1    = 0;
01007         ENTRY;
01008 
01009         LASSERT(lmv4 != lmv);
01010 
01011         lfsck_lmv_header_cpu_to_le(lmv4, lmv);
01012         lfsck_buf_init(buf, lmv4, sizeof(*lmv4));
01013 
01014         if (!locked) {
01015                 rc = lfsck_ibits_lock(env, lfsck, obj, &lh,
01016                                       MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE |
01017                                       MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR, LCK_EX);
01018                 if (rc != 0)
01019                         GOTO(log, rc);
01020         }
01021 
01022         th = dt_trans_create(env, dev);
01023         if (IS_ERR(th))
01024                 GOTO(log, rc = PTR_ERR(th));
01025 
01026         /* For remote updating LMV EA, there will be further LFSCK action on
01027          * remote MDT after the updating, so update the LMV EA synchronously. */
01028         if (dt_object_remote(obj))
01029                 th->th_sync = 1;
01030 
01031         rc = dt_declare_xattr_set(env, obj, buf, XATTR_NAME_LMV, 0, th);
01032         if (rc != 0)
01033                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01034 
01035         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dev, th);
01036         if (rc != 0)
01037                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01038 
01039         dt_write_lock(env, obj, 0);
01040         if (unlikely(lfsck_is_dead_obj(obj)))
01041                 GOTO(unlock, rc = 1);
01042 
01043         if (lfsck->li_bookmark_ram.lb_param & LPF_DRYRUN)
01044                 GOTO(unlock, rc = 0);
01045 
01046         rc = dt_xattr_set(env, obj, buf, XATTR_NAME_LMV, 0, th);
01047 
01048         GOTO(unlock, rc);
01049 
01050 unlock:
01051         dt_write_unlock(env, obj);
01052 
01053 stop:
01054         rc1 = dt_trans_stop(env, dev, th);
01055         if (rc == 0)
01056                 rc = rc1;
01057 
01058 log:
01059         lfsck_ibits_unlock(&lh, LCK_EX);
01060         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: namespace LFSCK updated the %s LMV EA "
01061                "for the object "DFID": rc = %d\n",
01062                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck),
01063                lmv->lmv_magic == LMV_MAGIC ? "master" : "slave",
01064                PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(obj)), rc);
01065 
01066         return rc;
01067 }
01068 
01089 static int lfsck_allow_regenerate_master_lmv(const struct lu_env *env,
01090                                              struct lfsck_component *com,
01091                                              struct dt_object *obj,
01092                                              const struct lu_fid *cfid,
01093                                              __u32 cidx)
01094 {
01095         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
01096         struct lu_fid                   *tfid   = &info->lti_fid3;
01097         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
01098         struct lu_dirent                *ent    =
01099                         (struct lu_dirent *)info->lti_key;
01100         const struct dt_it_ops          *iops;
01101         struct dt_it                    *di;
01102         __u64                            cookie;
01103         __u32                            args;
01104         int                              rc;
01105         __u16                            type;
01106         ENTRY;
01107 
01108         if (unlikely(!dt_try_as_dir(env, obj)))
01109                 RETURN(-ENOTDIR);
01110 
01111         /* Check whether the shard and the master MDT-object matches or not. */
01112         snprintf(info->lti_tmpbuf, sizeof(info->lti_tmpbuf), DFID":%u",
01113                  PFID(cfid), cidx);
01114         rc = dt_lookup(env, obj, (struct dt_rec *)tfid,
01115                        (const struct dt_key *)info->lti_tmpbuf);
01116         if (rc != 0)
01117                 RETURN(rc);
01118 
01119         if (!lu_fid_eq(tfid, cfid))
01120                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
01121 
01122         args = lfsck->li_args_dir & ~(LUDA_VERIFY | LUDA_VERIFY_DRYRUN);
01123         iops = &obj->do_index_ops->dio_it;
01124         di = iops->init(env, obj, args);
01125         if (IS_ERR(di))
01126                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(di));
01127 
01128         rc = iops->load(env, di, 0);
01129         if (rc == 0)
01130                 rc = iops->next(env, di);
01131         else if (rc > 0)
01132                 rc = 0;
01133 
01134         if (rc != 0)
01135                 GOTO(out, rc);
01136 
01137         do {
01138                 rc = iops->rec(env, di, (struct dt_rec *)ent, args);
01139                 if (rc == 0)
01140                         rc = lfsck_unpack_ent(ent, &cookie, &type);
01141 
01142                 if (rc != 0)
01143                         GOTO(out, rc);
01144 
01145                 /* skip dot and dotdot entries */
01146                 if (name_is_dot_or_dotdot(ent->lde_name, ent->lde_namelen))
01147                         goto next;
01148 
01149                 /* If the subdir name does not match the shard name rule, then
01150                  * it is quite possible that it is NOT a shard, but created by
01151                  * someone after the master MDT-object lost the master LMV EA.
01152                  * But it is also possible that the subdir name entry crashed,
01153                  * under such double failure cases, the LFSCK cannot know how
01154                  * to repair the inconsistency. For data safe, the LFSCK will
01155                  * mark the master MDT-object as read-only. The administrator
01156                  * can fix the bad shard name manually, then run LFSCK again.
01157                  *
01158                  * XXX: If the subdir name matches the shard name rule, but it
01159                  *      is not a real shard of the striped directory, instead,
01160                  *      it was created by someone after the master MDT-object
01161                  *      lost the LMV EA, then re-generating the master LMV EA
01162                  *      will cause such subdir to be invisible to client, and
01163                  *      if its index occupies some lost shard index, then the
01164                  *      LFSCK will use it to replace the bad shard, and cause
01165                  *      the subdir (itself) to be invisible for ever. */
01166                 if (lfsck_shard_name_to_index(env, ent->lde_name,
01167                                 ent->lde_namelen, type, &ent->lde_fid) < 0)
01168                         GOTO(out, rc = 1);
01169 
01170 next:
01171                 rc = iops->next(env, di);
01172         } while (rc == 0);
01173 
01174         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01175 
01176 out:
01177         iops->put(env, di);
01178         iops->fini(env, di);
01179 
01180         return rc;
01181 }
01182 
01197 static int lfsck_namespace_notify_lmv_remote(const struct lu_env *env,
01198                                              struct lfsck_component *com,
01199                                              struct dt_object *obj,
01200                                              __u32 event, __u32 flags,
01201                                              __u32 index)
01202 {
01203         struct lfsck_request            *lr     = &lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_lr;
01204         const struct lu_fid             *fid    = lfsck_dto2fid(obj);
01205         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
01206         struct lfsck_tgt_desc           *ltd    = NULL;
01207         struct ptlrpc_request           *req    = NULL;
01208         int                              rc;
01209         ENTRY;
01210 
01211         ltd = lfsck_tgt_get(&lfsck->li_mdt_descs, index);
01212         if (ltd == NULL)
01213                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENODEV);
01214 
01215         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(ltd->ltd_exp),
01216                                    &RQF_LFSCK_NOTIFY);
01217         if (req == NULL)
01218                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01219 
01220         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OBD_VERSION, LFSCK_NOTIFY);
01221         if (rc != 0) {
01222                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
01223 
01224                 GOTO(out, rc);
01225         }
01226 
01227         lr = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_LFSCK_REQUEST);
01228         memset(lr, 0, sizeof(*lr));
01229         lr->lr_event = event;
01230         lr->lr_index = lfsck_dev_idx(lfsck);
01231         lr->lr_active = LFSCK_TYPE_NAMESPACE;
01232         lr->lr_fid = *fid;
01233         lr->lr_flags = flags;
01234 
01235         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01236         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01237         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01238 
01239         GOTO(out, rc = (rc == -ENOENT ? 1 : rc));
01240 
01241 out:
01242         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: namespace LFSCK notify LMV EA updated for the "
01243                "object "DFID" on MDT %x remotely with event %u, flags %u: "
01244                "rc = %d\n", lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), PFID(fid), index,
01245                event, flags, rc);
01246 
01247         if (ltd != NULL)
01248                 lfsck_tgt_put(ltd);
01249 
01250         return rc;
01251 }
01252 
01264 int lfsck_namespace_notify_lmv_master_local(const struct lu_env *env,
01265                                             struct lfsck_component *com,
01266                                             struct dt_object *obj)
01267 {
01268         struct lfsck_instance      *lfsck = com->lc_lfsck;
01269         struct lfsck_namespace     *ns    = com->lc_file_ram;
01270         struct lmv_mds_md_v1       *lmv4  = &lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_lmv4;
01271         struct lfsck_lmv_unit      *llu;
01272         struct lfsck_lmv           *llmv;
01273         struct lfsck_slave_lmv_rec *lslr;
01274         int                         count = 0;
01275         int                         rc;
01276         ENTRY;
01277 
01278         if (lfsck->li_bookmark_ram.lb_param & LPF_DRYRUN)
01279                 RETURN(0);
01280 
01281         rc = lfsck_read_stripe_lmv(env, obj, lmv4);
01282         if (rc != 0)
01283                 RETURN(rc);
01284 
01285         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(llu);
01286         if (unlikely(llu == NULL))
01287                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01288 
01289         if (lmv4->lmv_stripe_count < 1)
01290                 count = LFSCK_LMV_DEF_STRIPES;
01291         else if (lmv4->lmv_stripe_count > LFSCK_LMV_MAX_STRIPES)
01292                 count = LFSCK_LMV_MAX_STRIPES;
01293         else
01294                 count = lmv4->lmv_stripe_count;
01295 
01296         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(lslr, sizeof(struct lfsck_slave_lmv_rec) * count);
01297         if (lslr == NULL) {
01298                 OBD_FREE_PTR(llu);
01299 
01300                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01301         }
01302 
01303         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&llu->llu_link);
01304         llu->llu_lfsck = lfsck;
01305         llu->llu_obj = lfsck_object_get(obj);
01306         llmv = &llu->llu_lmv;
01307         llmv->ll_lmv_master = 1;
01308         llmv->ll_inline = 1;
01309         atomic_set(&llmv->ll_ref, 1);
01310         llmv->ll_stripes_allocated = count;
01311         llmv->ll_hash_type = LMV_HASH_TYPE_UNKNOWN;
01312         llmv->ll_lslr = lslr;
01313         llmv->ll_lmv = *lmv4;
01314 
01315         down_write(&com->lc_sem);
01316         if (ns->ln_status != LS_SCANNING_PHASE1 &&
01317             ns->ln_status != LS_SCANNING_PHASE2) {
01318                 ns->ln_striped_dirs_skipped++;
01319                 up_write(&com->lc_sem);
01320                 lfsck_lmv_put(env, llmv);
01321         } else {
01322                 ns->ln_striped_dirs_repaired++;
01323                 spin_lock(&lfsck->li_lock);
01324                 list_add_tail(&llu->llu_link, &lfsck->li_list_lmv);
01325                 spin_unlock(&lfsck->li_lock);
01326                 up_write(&com->lc_sem);
01327         }
01328 
01329         RETURN(0);
01330 }
01331 
01359 static int lfsck_namespace_set_lmv_master(const struct lu_env *env,
01360                                           struct lfsck_component *com,
01361                                           struct dt_object *obj,
01362                                           struct lmv_mds_md_v1 *lmv,
01363                                           const struct lu_fid *cfid,
01364                                           __u32 cidx, __u32 flags)
01365 {
01366         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
01367         struct lmv_mds_md_v1            *lmv3   = &info->lti_lmv3;
01368         struct lu_seq_range             *range  = &info->lti_range;
01369         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
01370         struct seq_server_site          *ss     = lfsck_dev_site(lfsck);
01371         struct lustre_handle             lh     = { 0 };
01372         int                              pidx   = -1;
01373         int                              rc     = 0;
01374         ENTRY;
01375 
01376         fld_range_set_mdt(range);
01377         rc = fld_server_lookup(env, ss->ss_server_fld,
01378                                fid_seq(lfsck_dto2fid(obj)), range);
01379         if (rc != 0)
01380                 GOTO(log, rc);
01381 
01382         pidx = range->lsr_index;
01383         rc = lfsck_ibits_lock(env, lfsck, obj, &lh,
01384                               MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE | MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR,
01385                               LCK_EX);
01386         if (rc != 0)
01387                 GOTO(log, rc);
01388 
01389         rc = lfsck_read_stripe_lmv(env, obj, lmv3);
01390         if (rc == -ENODATA) {
01391                 if (!(flags & LEF_SET_LMV_ALL))
01392                         GOTO(log, rc);
01393 
01394                 *lmv3 = *lmv;
01395         } else if (rc == 0) {
01396                 if (flags & LEF_SET_LMV_ALL)
01397                         GOTO(log, rc = 1);
01398 
01399                 if (flags & LEF_SET_LMV_HASH)
01400                         lmv3->lmv_hash_type = lmv->lmv_hash_type;
01401         } else {
01402                 GOTO(log, rc);
01403         }
01404 
01405         lmv3->lmv_magic = LMV_MAGIC;
01406         lmv3->lmv_master_mdt_index = pidx;
01407 
01408         if (flags & LEF_SET_LMV_ALL) {
01409                 rc = lfsck_allow_regenerate_master_lmv(env, com, obj,
01410                                                        cfid, cidx);
01411                 if (rc > 0) {
01412                         rc = lfsck_disable_master_lmv(env, com, obj, false);
01413 
01414                         GOTO(log, rc = (rc == 0 ? 1 : rc));
01415                 }
01416 
01417                 if (rc < 0)
01418                         GOTO(log, rc);
01419 
01420                 /* To indicate that the master has ever lost LMV EA. */
01421                 lmv3->lmv_hash_type |= LMV_HASH_FLAG_LOST_LMV;
01422         }
01423 
01424         rc = lfsck_namespace_update_lmv(env, com, obj, lmv3, true);
01425         if (rc == 0 && flags & LEF_SET_LMV_ALL) {
01426                 if (dt_object_remote(obj))
01427                         rc = lfsck_namespace_notify_lmv_remote(env, com, obj,
01428                                                 LE_SET_LMV_MASTER, 0, pidx);
01429                 else
01430                         rc = lfsck_namespace_notify_lmv_master_local(env, com,
01431                                                                      obj);
01432         }
01433 
01434         GOTO(log, rc);
01435 
01436 log:
01437         lfsck_ibits_unlock(&lh, LCK_EX);
01438         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: namespace LFSCK set master LMV EA for the object "
01439                DFID" on the %s MDT %d, flags %x: rc = %d\n",
01440                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(obj)),
01441                dt_object_remote(obj) ? "remote" : "local", pidx, flags, rc);
01442 
01443         if (rc <= 0) {
01444                 struct lfsck_namespace *ns = com->lc_file_ram;
01445 
01446                 ns->ln_flags |= LF_INCONSISTENT;
01447         }
01448 
01449         return rc;
01450 }
01451 
01473 int lfsck_namespace_repair_bad_name_hash(const struct lu_env *env,
01474                                          struct lfsck_component *com,
01475                                          struct dt_object *shard,
01476                                          struct lfsck_lmv *llmv,
01477                                          const char *name)
01478 {
01479         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
01480         struct lu_fid                   *pfid   = &info->lti_fid3;
01481         struct lmv_mds_md_v1            *lmv2   = &info->lti_lmv2;
01482         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
01483         struct dt_object                *parent = NULL;
01484         int                              rc     = 0;
01485         ENTRY;
01486 
01487         rc = dt_lookup(env, shard, (struct dt_rec *)pfid,
01488                        (const struct dt_key *)dotdot);
01489         if (rc != 0 || !fid_is_sane(pfid))
01490                 GOTO(log, rc);
01491 
01492         parent = lfsck_object_find_bottom(env, lfsck, pfid);
01493         if (IS_ERR(parent))
01494                 GOTO(log, rc = PTR_ERR(parent));
01495 
01496         if (unlikely(!dt_object_exists(parent)))
01497                 /* The parent object was previously accessed when verifying
01498                  * the slave LMV EA.  If this condition is true it is because
01499                  * the striped directory is being removed. */
01500                 GOTO(log, rc = 1);
01501 
01502         *lmv2 = llmv->ll_lmv;
01503         lmv2->lmv_hash_type = LMV_HASH_TYPE_UNKNOWN | LMV_HASH_FLAG_BAD_TYPE;
01504         rc = lfsck_namespace_set_lmv_master(env, com, parent, lmv2,
01505                                             lfsck_dto2fid(shard),
01506                                             llmv->ll_lmv.lmv_master_mdt_index,
01507                                             LEF_SET_LMV_HASH);
01508 
01509         GOTO(log, rc);
01510 
01511 log:
01512         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: namespace LFSCK assistant found bad name hash "
01513                "on the MDT %x, parent "DFID", name %s, shard_%x "DFID
01514                ": rc = %d\n",
01515                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), lfsck_dev_idx(lfsck),
01516                PFID(pfid), name, llmv->ll_lmv.lmv_master_mdt_index,
01517                PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(shard)), rc);
01518 
01519         if (parent != NULL && !IS_ERR(parent))
01520                 lfsck_object_put(env, parent);
01521 
01522         return rc;
01523 }
01524 
01545 int lfsck_namespace_scan_shard(const struct lu_env *env,
01546                                struct lfsck_component *com,
01547                                struct dt_object *child)
01548 {
01549         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
01550         struct lmv_mds_md_v1            *lmv    = &info->lti_lmv;
01551         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
01552         struct lfsck_namespace          *ns     = com->lc_file_ram;
01553         struct ptlrpc_thread            *thread = &lfsck->li_thread;
01554         struct lu_dirent                *ent    =
01555                         (struct lu_dirent *)info->lti_key;
01556         struct lfsck_bookmark           *bk     = &lfsck->li_bookmark_ram;
01557         struct lfsck_lmv                *llmv   = NULL;
01558         const struct dt_it_ops          *iops;
01559         struct dt_it                    *di;
01560         __u64                            cookie;
01561         __u32                            args;
01562         int                              rc;
01563         __u16                            type;
01564         ENTRY;
01565 
01566         rc = lfsck_read_stripe_lmv(env, child, lmv);
01567         if (rc != 0)
01568                 RETURN(rc == -ENODATA ? 1 : rc);
01569 
01570         if (lmv->lmv_magic != LMV_MAGIC_STRIPE)
01571                 RETURN(1);
01572 
01573         if (unlikely(!dt_try_as_dir(env, child)))
01574                 RETURN(-ENOTDIR);
01575 
01576         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(llmv);
01577         if (llmv == NULL)
01578                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01579 
01580         llmv->ll_lmv_slave = 1;
01581         llmv->ll_lmv_verified = 1;
01582         llmv->ll_lmv = *lmv;
01583         atomic_set(&llmv->ll_ref, 1);
01584 
01585         args = lfsck->li_args_dir & ~(LUDA_VERIFY | LUDA_VERIFY_DRYRUN);
01586         iops = &child->do_index_ops->dio_it;
01587         di = iops->init(env, child, args);
01588         if (IS_ERR(di))
01589                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(di));
01590 
01591         rc = iops->load(env, di, 0);
01592         if (rc == 0)
01593                 rc = iops->next(env, di);
01594         else if (rc > 0)
01595                 rc = 0;
01596 
01597         while (rc == 0) {
01598                 if (CFS_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LFSCK_DELAY3, cfs_fail_val) &&
01599                     unlikely(!thread_is_running(thread)))
01600                         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01601 
01602                 rc = iops->rec(env, di, (struct dt_rec *)ent, args);
01603                 if (rc == 0)
01604                         rc = lfsck_unpack_ent(ent, &cookie, &type);
01605 
01606                 if (rc != 0) {
01607                         if (bk->lb_param & LPF_FAILOUT)
01608                                 GOTO(out, rc);
01609 
01610                         goto next;
01611                 }
01612 
01613                 /* skip dot and dotdot entries */
01614                 if (name_is_dot_or_dotdot(ent->lde_name, ent->lde_namelen))
01615                         goto next;
01616 
01617                 if (!lfsck_is_valid_slave_name_entry(env, llmv, ent->lde_name,
01618                                                      ent->lde_namelen)) {
01619                         ns->ln_flags |= LF_INCONSISTENT;
01620                         rc = lfsck_namespace_repair_bad_name_hash(env, com,
01621                                                 child, llmv, ent->lde_name);
01622                         if (rc == 0)
01623                                 ns->ln_name_hash_repaired++;
01624                 }
01625 
01626                 if (rc < 0 && bk->lb_param & LPF_FAILOUT)
01627                         GOTO(out, rc);
01628 
01629                 /* Rate control. */
01630                 lfsck_control_speed(lfsck);
01631                 if (unlikely(!thread_is_running(thread)))
01632                         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01633 
01634                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LFSCK_FATAL2)) {
01635                         spin_lock(&lfsck->li_lock);
01636                         thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_STOPPING);
01637                         spin_unlock(&lfsck->li_lock);
01638 
01639                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01640                 }
01641 
01642 next:
01643                 rc = iops->next(env, di);
01644         }
01645 
01646         GOTO(out, rc);
01647 
01648 out:
01649         iops->put(env, di);
01650         iops->fini(env, di);
01651         lfsck_lmv_put(env, llmv);
01652 
01653         return rc;
01654 }
01655 
01672 int lfsck_namespace_verify_stripe_slave(const struct lu_env *env,
01673                                         struct lfsck_component *com,
01674                                         struct dt_object *obj,
01675                                         struct lfsck_lmv *llmv)
01676 {
01677         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
01678         char                            *name   = info->lti_key;
01679         char                            *name2;
01680         struct lu_fid                   *pfid   = &info->lti_fid3;
01681         const struct lu_fid             *cfid   = lfsck_dto2fid(obj);
01682         struct lu_fid                    tfid;
01683         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
01684         struct lmv_mds_md_v1            *clmv   = &llmv->ll_lmv;
01685         struct lmv_mds_md_v1            *plmv   = &info->lti_lmv;
01686         struct dt_object                *parent = NULL;
01687         int                              rc     = 0;
01688         ENTRY;
01689 
01690         if (!lfsck_is_valid_slave_lmv(clmv)) {
01691                 rc = lfsck_namespace_trace_update(env, com, cfid,
01692                                         LNTF_UNCERTAIN_LMV, true);
01693 
01694                 GOTO(out, rc);
01695         }
01696 
01697         rc = dt_lookup(env, obj, (struct dt_rec *)pfid,
01698                        (const struct dt_key *)dotdot);
01699         if (rc != 0 || !fid_is_sane(pfid)) {
01700                 rc = lfsck_namespace_trace_update(env, com, cfid,
01701                                         LNTF_UNCERTAIN_LMV, true);
01702 
01703                 GOTO(out, rc);
01704         }
01705 
01706         parent = lfsck_object_find_bottom(env, lfsck, pfid);
01707         if (IS_ERR(parent)) {
01708                 rc = lfsck_namespace_trace_update(env, com, cfid,
01709                                         LNTF_UNCERTAIN_LMV, true);
01710 
01711                 GOTO(out, rc);
01712         }
01713 
01714         if (unlikely(!dt_object_exists(parent)))
01715                 GOTO(out, rc = 1);
01716 
01717         if (unlikely(!dt_try_as_dir(env, parent)))
01718                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOTDIR);
01719 
01720         rc = lfsck_read_stripe_lmv(env, parent, plmv);
01721         if (rc != 0) {
01722                 int rc1;
01723 
01724                 /* If the parent has no LMV EA, then it maybe because:
01725                  * 1) The parent lost the LMV EA.
01726                  * 2) The child claims a wrong (slave) LMV EA. */
01727                 if (rc == -ENODATA)
01728                         rc = lfsck_namespace_set_lmv_master(env, com, parent,
01729                                         clmv, cfid, clmv->lmv_master_mdt_index,
01730                                         LEF_SET_LMV_ALL);
01731                 else
01732                         rc = 0;
01733 
01734                 rc1 = lfsck_namespace_trace_update(env, com, cfid,
01735                                                    LNTF_UNCERTAIN_LMV, true);
01736 
01737                 GOTO(out, rc = (rc < 0 ? rc : rc1));
01738         }
01739 
01740         /* Unmatched magic or stripe count. */
01741         if (unlikely(plmv->lmv_magic != LMV_MAGIC ||
01742                      plmv->lmv_stripe_count != clmv->lmv_stripe_count)) {
01743                 rc = lfsck_namespace_trace_update(env, com, cfid,
01744                                                   LNTF_UNCERTAIN_LMV, true);
01745 
01746                 GOTO(out, rc);
01747         }
01748 
01749         /* If the master hash type has been set as LMV_HASH_TYPE_UNKNOWN,
01750          * then the slave hash type is not important. */
01751         if ((plmv->lmv_hash_type & LMV_HASH_TYPE_MASK) ==
01752             LMV_HASH_TYPE_UNKNOWN &&
01753             plmv->lmv_hash_type & LMV_HASH_FLAG_BAD_TYPE)
01754                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01755 
01756         /* Unmatched hash type. */
01757         if (unlikely((plmv->lmv_hash_type & LMV_HASH_TYPE_MASK) !=
01758                      (clmv->lmv_hash_type & LMV_HASH_TYPE_MASK))) {
01759                 rc = lfsck_namespace_trace_update(env, com, cfid,
01760                                                   LNTF_UNCERTAIN_LMV, true);
01761 
01762                 GOTO(out, rc);
01763         }
01764 
01765         snprintf(info->lti_tmpbuf2, sizeof(info->lti_tmpbuf2), DFID":%u",
01766                  PFID(cfid), clmv->lmv_master_mdt_index);
01767         name2 = info->lti_tmpbuf2;
01768 
01769         rc = lfsck_links_get_first(env, obj, name, &tfid);
01770         if (rc == 0 && strcmp(name, name2) == 0 && lu_fid_eq(pfid, &tfid)) {
01771                 llmv->ll_lmv_verified = 1;
01772 
01773                 GOTO(out, rc);
01774         }
01775 
01776         rc = dt_lookup(env, parent, (struct dt_rec *)&tfid,
01777                        (const struct dt_key *)name2);
01778         if (rc != 0 || !lu_fid_eq(cfid, &tfid))
01779                 rc = lfsck_namespace_trace_update(env, com, cfid,
01780                                                   LNTF_UNCERTAIN_LMV, true);
01781         else
01782                 llmv->ll_lmv_verified = 1;
01783 
01784         GOTO(out, rc);
01785 
01786 out:
01787         if (parent != NULL && !IS_ERR(parent))
01788                 lfsck_object_put(env, parent);
01789 
01790         return rc;
01791 }
01792 
01817 int lfsck_namespace_striped_dir_rescan(const struct lu_env *env,
01818                                        struct lfsck_component *com,
01819                                        struct lfsck_namespace_req *lnr)
01820 {
01821         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
01822         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
01823         struct lfsck_namespace          *ns     = com->lc_file_ram;
01824         struct lfsck_lmv                *llmv   = lnr->lnr_lmv;
01825         struct lmv_mds_md_v1            *lmv    = &llmv->ll_lmv;
01826         struct lmv_mds_md_v1            *lmv2   = &info->lti_lmv2;
01827         struct lfsck_assistant_object   *lso    = lnr->lnr_lar.lar_parent;
01828         const struct lu_fid             *pfid   = &lso->lso_fid;
01829         struct dt_object                *dir    = NULL;
01830         struct dt_object                *obj    = NULL;
01831         struct lu_seq_range             *range  = &info->lti_range;
01832         struct seq_server_site          *ss     = lfsck_dev_site(lfsck);
01833         __u32                            stripe_count;
01834         __u32                            hash_type;
01835         int                              rc     = 0;
01836         int                              i;
01837         ENTRY;
01838 
01839         if (llmv->ll_lmv_slave) {
01840                 if (llmv->ll_lmv_verified) {
01841                         ns->ln_striped_shards_scanned++;
01842                         lfsck_namespace_trace_update(env, com, pfid,
01843                                         LNTF_UNCERTAIN_LMV |
01844                                         LNTF_RECHECK_NAME_HASH, false);
01845                 }
01846 
01847                 RETURN(0);
01848         }
01849 
01850         /* Either the striped directory has been disabled or only part of
01851          * the striped directory have been scanned. The LFSCK cannot repair
01852          * something based on incompleted knowledge. So skip it. */
01853         if (llmv->ll_ignore || llmv->ll_exit_value <= 0)
01854                 RETURN(0);
01855 
01856         /* There ever been some failure, as to the LFSCK cannot know whether
01857          * it has got the global knowledge about the LMV EA consistency or not,
01858          * so it cannot make reparation about the incompleted knowledge. */
01859         if (llmv->ll_failed) {
01860                 ns->ln_striped_dirs_scanned++;
01861                 ns->ln_striped_dirs_failed++;
01862 
01863                 RETURN(0);
01864         }
01865 
01866         if (lmv->lmv_stripe_count > LFSCK_LMV_MAX_STRIPES)
01867                 stripe_count = max(llmv->ll_max_filled_off + 1,
01868                                    llmv->ll_max_stripe_count);
01869         else
01870                 stripe_count = max(llmv->ll_max_filled_off + 1,
01871                                    lmv->lmv_stripe_count);
01872 
01873         if (lmv->lmv_stripe_count != stripe_count) {
01874                 lmv->lmv_stripe_count = stripe_count;
01875                 llmv->ll_lmv_updated = 1;
01876         }
01877 
01878         if (!lmv_is_known_hash_type(lmv->lmv_hash_type) &&
01879             !(lmv->lmv_hash_type & LMV_HASH_FLAG_BAD_TYPE) &&
01880             lmv_is_known_hash_type(llmv->ll_hash_type)) {
01881                 hash_type = llmv->ll_hash_type & LMV_HASH_TYPE_MASK;
01882                 lmv->lmv_hash_type = llmv->ll_hash_type;
01883                 llmv->ll_lmv_updated = 1;
01884         } else {
01885                 hash_type = lmv->lmv_hash_type & LMV_HASH_TYPE_MASK;
01886                 if (!lmv_is_known_hash_type(hash_type))
01887                         hash_type = LMV_HASH_TYPE_UNKNOWN;
01888         }
01889 
01890         if (llmv->ll_lmv_updated) {
01891                 if (dir == NULL) {
01892                         dir = lfsck_assistant_object_load(env, lfsck, lso);
01893                         if (IS_ERR(dir)) {
01894                                 rc = PTR_ERR(dir);
01895 
01896                                 RETURN(rc == -ENOENT ? 0 : rc);
01897                         }
01898                 }
01899 
01900                 lmv->lmv_layout_version++;
01901                 rc = lfsck_namespace_update_lmv(env, com, dir, lmv, false);
01902                 if (rc != 0)
01903                         RETURN(rc);
01904 
01905                 ns->ln_striped_dirs_scanned++;
01906                 ns->ln_striped_dirs_repaired++;
01907         }
01908 
01909         fld_range_set_mdt(range);
01910         for (i = 0; i <= llmv->ll_max_filled_off; i++) {
01911                 struct lfsck_slave_lmv_rec *lslr = llmv->ll_lslr + i;
01912                 const struct lu_fid *cfid = &lslr->lslr_fid;
01913                 const struct lu_name *cname;
01914                 struct linkea_data ldata = { NULL };
01915                 int len;
01916                 int rc1 = 0;
01917                 bool repair_linkea = false;
01918                 bool repair_lmvea = false;
01919                 bool rename = false;
01920                 bool create = false;
01921                 bool linkea_repaired = false;
01922                 bool lmvea_repaired = false;
01923                 bool rename_repaired = false;
01924                 bool create_repaired = false;
01925 
01926                 /* LMV EA hole. */
01927                 if (fid_is_zero(cfid))
01928                         continue;
01929 
01930                 len = snprintf(info->lti_tmpbuf, sizeof(info->lti_tmpbuf),
01931                                DFID":%u", PFID(cfid), i);
01932                 cname = lfsck_name_get_const(env, info->lti_tmpbuf, len);
01933                 memcpy(lnr->lnr_name, info->lti_tmpbuf, len);
01934 
01935                 obj = lfsck_object_find_bottom_nowait(env, lfsck, cfid);
01936                 if (IS_ERR(obj)) {
01937                         if (dir == NULL) {
01938                                 dir = lfsck_assistant_object_load(env, lfsck,
01939                                                                   lso);
01940                                 if (IS_ERR(dir)) {
01941                                         if (PTR_ERR(dir) == -ENOENT)
01942                                                 RETURN(0);
01943 
01944                                         dir = NULL;
01945                                 }
01946                         } else if (lfsck_is_dead_obj(dir)) {
01947                                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01948                         }
01949 
01950                         rc1 = PTR_ERR(obj);
01951                         goto next;
01952                 }
01953 
01954                 switch (lslr->lslr_flags) {
01955                 case LSLF_NONE:
01956                         if (llmv->ll_inline ||
01957                             lslr->lslr_stripe_count != stripe_count ||
01958                             (lslr->lslr_hash_type & LMV_HASH_TYPE_MASK) !=
01959                              hash_type)
01960                                 repair_lmvea = true;
01961                         break;
01962                 case LSLF_BAD_INDEX2:
01963                         /* The index in the slave LMV EA is right,
01964                          * the name entry should be updated. */
01965                         rename = true;
01966                         snprintf(info->lti_tmpbuf2, sizeof(info->lti_tmpbuf2),
01967                                  DFID":%u", PFID(cfid), lslr->lslr_index);
01968                         if (llmv->ll_inline ||
01969                             lslr->lslr_stripe_count != stripe_count ||
01970                             (lslr->lslr_hash_type & LMV_HASH_TYPE_MASK) !=
01971                              hash_type)
01972                                 repair_lmvea = true;
01973                         break;
01974                 case LSLF_BAD_INDEX1:
01975                         /* The index in the name entry is right,
01976                          * the slave LMV EA should be updated. */
01977                 case LSLF_NO_LMVEA:
01978                         repair_lmvea = true;
01979                         break;
01980                 case LSLF_DANGLING:
01981                         create = true;
01982                         goto repair;
01983                 default:
01984                         break;
01985                 }
01986 
01987                 rc1 = lfsck_links_read(env, obj, &ldata);
01988                 if (rc1 == -ENOENT) {
01989                         create = true;
01990                         goto repair;
01991                 }
01992 
01993                 if (rc1 == -EINVAL || rc1 == -ENODATA) {
01994                         repair_linkea = true;
01995                         goto repair;
01996                 }
01997 
01998                 if (rc1 != 0)
01999                         goto next;
02000 
02001                 if (ldata.ld_leh->leh_reccount != 1) {
02002                         repair_linkea = true;
02003                         goto repair;
02004                 }
02005 
02006                 rc1 = linkea_links_find(&ldata, cname, pfid);
02007                 if (rc1 != 0)
02008                         repair_linkea = true;
02009 
02010 repair:
02011                 if (create) {
02012                         if (dir == NULL) {
02013                                 dir = lfsck_assistant_object_load(env, lfsck,
02014                                                                   lso);
02015                                 if (IS_ERR(dir)) {
02016                                         rc1 = PTR_ERR(dir);
02017 
02018                                         if (rc1 == -ENOENT)
02019                                                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
02020 
02021                                         dir = NULL;
02022                                         goto next;
02023                                 }
02024                         }
02025 
02026                         rc1 = lfsck_namespace_repair_dangling(env, com, dir,
02027                                                               obj, lnr);
02028                         if (rc1 >= 0) {
02029                                 create_repaired = true;
02030                                 if (rc == 0)
02031                                         ns->ln_dangling_repaired++;
02032                         }
02033                 }
02034 
02035                 if (repair_lmvea) {
02036                         *lmv2 = *lmv;
02037                         lmv2->lmv_magic = LMV_MAGIC_STRIPE;
02038                         lmv2->lmv_stripe_count = stripe_count;
02039                         lmv2->lmv_master_mdt_index = i;
02040                         lmv2->lmv_hash_type = hash_type;
02041 
02042                         rc1 = lfsck_namespace_update_lmv(env, com, obj,
02043                                                          lmv2, false);
02044                         if (rc1 < 0)
02045                                 goto next;
02046 
02047                         if (dt_object_remote(obj)) {
02048                                 rc1 = fld_server_lookup(env, ss->ss_server_fld,
02049                                         fid_seq(lfsck_dto2fid(obj)), range);
02050                                 if (rc1 != 0)
02051                                         goto next;
02052 
02053                                 rc1 = lfsck_namespace_notify_lmv_remote(env,
02054                                                 com, obj, LE_SET_LMV_SLAVE, 0,
02055                                                 range->lsr_index);
02056                         } else {
02057                                 ns->ln_striped_shards_repaired++;
02058                                 rc1 = lfsck_namespace_trace_update(env, com,
02059                                         cfid, LNTF_RECHECK_NAME_HASH, true);
02060                         }
02061
