02062                         if (rc1 < 0)
02063                                 goto next;
02064 
02065                         if (rc1 >= 0)
02066                                 lmvea_repaired = true;
02067                 } else if (llmv->ll_inline) {
02068                         if (dt_object_remote(obj)) {
02069                                 rc1 = fld_server_lookup(env, ss->ss_server_fld,
02070                                         fid_seq(lfsck_dto2fid(obj)), range);
02071                                 if (rc1 != 0)
02072                                         goto next;
02073 
02074                                 /* The slave LMV EA on the remote shard is
02075                                  * correct, just notify the LFSCK instance
02076                                  * on such MDT to re-verify the name_hash. */
02077                                 rc1 = lfsck_namespace_notify_lmv_remote(env,
02078                                                 com, obj, LE_SET_LMV_SLAVE,
02079                                                 LEF_RECHECK_NAME_HASH,
02080                                                 range->lsr_index);
02081                         } else {
02082                                 rc1 = lfsck_namespace_trace_update(env, com,
02083                                         cfid, LNTF_RECHECK_NAME_HASH, true);
02084                         }
02085 
02086                         if (rc1 < 0)
02087                                 goto next;
02088                 }
02089 
02090                 if (rename) {
02091                         if (dir == NULL) {
02092                                 dir = lfsck_assistant_object_load(env, lfsck,
02093                                                                   lso);
02094                                 if (IS_ERR(dir)) {
02095                                         rc1 = PTR_ERR(dir);
02096 
02097                                         if (rc1 == -ENOENT)
02098                                                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
02099 
02100                                         dir = NULL;
02101                                         goto next;
02102                                 }
02103                         }
02104 
02105                         rc1 = lfsck_namespace_repair_dirent(env, com, dir, obj,
02106                                         info->lti_tmpbuf2, lnr->lnr_name,
02107                                         lnr->lnr_type, true, false);
02108                         if (rc1 >= 0) {
02109                                 rename_repaired = true;
02110                                 if (rc1 > 0) {
02111                                         ns->ln_dirent_repaired++;
02112                                         rc1 = lfsck_namespace_trace_update(env,
02113                                                 com, cfid,
02114                                                 LNTF_RECHECK_NAME_HASH, true);
02115                                 }
02116                         }
02117 
02118                         if (rc1 < 0)
02119                                 goto next;
02120                 }
02121 
02122                 if (repair_linkea) {
02123                         struct lustre_handle lh = { 0 };
02124 
02125                         rc1 = linkea_data_new(&ldata, &info->lti_big_buf);
02126                         if (rc1 != 0)
02127                                 goto next;
02128 
02129                         if (dir == NULL) {
02130                                 dir = lfsck_assistant_object_load(env, lfsck,
02131                                                                   lso);
02132                                 if (IS_ERR(dir)) {
02133                                         rc1 = PTR_ERR(dir);
02134 
02135                                         if (rc1 == -ENOENT)
02136                                                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
02137 
02138                                         dir = NULL;
02139                                         goto next;
02140                                 }
02141                         }
02142 
02143                         rc1 = linkea_add_buf(&ldata, cname, lfsck_dto2fid(dir));
02144                         if (rc1 != 0)
02145                                 goto next;
02146 
02147                         rc1 = lfsck_ibits_lock(env, lfsck, obj, &lh,
02148                                                MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE |
02149                                                MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR, LCK_EX);
02150                         if (rc1 != 0)
02151                                 goto next;
02152 
02153                         rc1 = lfsck_namespace_rebuild_linkea(env, com, obj,
02154                                                              &ldata);
02155                         lfsck_ibits_unlock(&lh, LCK_EX);
02156                         if (rc1 >= 0) {
02157                                 linkea_repaired = true;
02158                                 if (rc1 > 0)
02159                                         ns->ln_linkea_repaired++;
02160                         }
02161                 }
02162 
02163 next:
02164                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: namespace LFSCK repair the shard "
02165                       "%d "DFID" of the striped directory "DFID" with "
02166                       "dangling %s/%s, rename %s/%s, llinkea %s/%s, "
02167                       "repair_lmvea %s/%s: rc = %d\n", lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck),
02168                       i, PFID(cfid), PFID(&lnr->lnr_fid),
02169                       create ? "yes" : "no", create_repaired ? "yes" : "no",
02170                       rename ? "yes" : "no", rename_repaired ? "yes" : "no",
02171                       repair_linkea ? "yes" : "no",
02172                       linkea_repaired ? "yes" : "no",
02173                       repair_lmvea ? "yes" : "no",
02174                       lmvea_repaired ? "yes" : "no", rc1);
02175 
02176                 if (obj != NULL && !IS_ERR(obj)) {
02177                         lfsck_object_put(env, obj);
02178                         obj = NULL;
02179                 }
02180 
02181                 if (rc1 < 0) {
02182                         rc = rc1;
02183                         ns->ln_striped_shards_failed++;
02184                 }
02185         }
02186 
02187         GOTO(out, rc);
02188 
02189 out:
02190         if (obj != NULL && !IS_ERR(obj))
02191                 lfsck_object_put(env, obj);
02192 
02193         if (dir != NULL && !IS_ERR(dir))
02194                 lfsck_object_put(env, dir);
02195 
02196         return rc;
02197 }
02198 
02248 int lfsck_namespace_handle_striped_master(const struct lu_env *env,
02249                                           struct lfsck_component *com,
02250                                           struct lfsck_namespace_req *lnr)
02251 {
02252         struct lfsck_thread_info   *info        = lfsck_env_info(env);
02253         struct lmv_mds_md_v1       *lmv         = &info->lti_lmv;
02254         struct lfsck_instance      *lfsck       = com->lc_lfsck;
02255         struct lfsck_namespace     *ns          = com->lc_file_ram;
02256         struct lfsck_lmv           *llmv        = lnr->lnr_lmv;
02257         struct lfsck_assistant_object *lso      = lnr->lnr_lar.lar_parent;
02258         const struct lu_fid        *pfid        = &lso->lso_fid;
02259         struct dt_object           *dir;
02260         struct dt_object           *obj         = NULL;
02261         struct dt_device           *dev         = NULL;
02262         int                         shard_idx   = 0;
02263         int                         stripe      = 0;
02264         int                         rc          = 0;
02265         int                         depth       = 0;
02266         bool                        repaired    = false;
02267         enum lfsck_namespace_inconsistency_type type = LNIT_NONE;
02268         ENTRY;
02269 
02270         if (unlikely(llmv->ll_ignore))
02271                 RETURN(0);
02272 
02273         dir = lfsck_assistant_object_load(env, lfsck, lso);
02274         if (IS_ERR(dir)) {
02275                 rc = PTR_ERR(dir);
02276 
02277                 RETURN(rc == -ENOENT ? 0 : rc);
02278         }
02279 
02280         shard_idx = lfsck_find_mdt_idx_by_fid(env, lfsck, &lnr->lnr_fid);
02281         if (shard_idx < 0)
02282                 GOTO(fail_lmv, rc = shard_idx);
02283 
02284         if (shard_idx == lfsck_dev_idx(lfsck)) {
02285                 if (unlikely(strcmp(lnr->lnr_name, dotdot) == 0))
02286                         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
02287 
02288                 dev = lfsck->li_bottom;
02289         } else {
02290                 struct lfsck_tgt_desc *ltd;
02291 
02292                 /* Usually, some local filesystem consistency verification
02293                  * tools can guarantee the local namespace tree consistenct.
02294                  * So the LFSCK will only verify the remote directory. */
02295                 if (unlikely(strcmp(lnr->lnr_name, dotdot) == 0)) {
02296                         rc = lfsck_namespace_trace_update(env, com, pfid,
02297                                                 LNTF_CHECK_PARENT, true);
02298 
02299                         GOTO(out, rc);
02300                 }
02301 
02302                 ltd = lfsck_ltd2tgt(&lfsck->li_mdt_descs, shard_idx);
02303                 if (unlikely(ltd == NULL)) {
02304                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: cannot talk with MDT %x which "
02305                                "did not join the namespace LFSCK\n",
02306                                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), shard_idx);
02307                         lfsck_lad_set_bitmap(env, com, shard_idx);
02308 
02309                         GOTO(fail_lmv, rc = -ENODEV);
02310                 }
02311 
02312                 dev = ltd->ltd_tgt;
02313         }
02314 
02315         obj = lfsck_object_find_by_dev_nowait(env, dev, &lnr->lnr_fid);
02316         if (IS_ERR(obj)) {
02317                 if (lfsck_is_dead_obj(dir))
02318                         RETURN(0);
02319 
02320                 GOTO(fail_lmv, rc = PTR_ERR(obj));
02321         }
02322 
02323         if (!dt_object_exists(obj)) {
02324                 stripe = lfsck_shard_name_to_index(env, lnr->lnr_name,
02325                                 lnr->lnr_namelen, lnr->lnr_type, &lnr->lnr_fid);
02326                 if (stripe < 0) {
02327                         type = LNIT_BAD_DIRENT;
02328 
02329                         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
02330                 }
02331 
02332 dangling:
02333                 rc = lfsck_namespace_check_exist(env, dir, obj, lnr->lnr_name);
02334                 if (rc == 0) {
02335                         memset(lmv, 0, sizeof(*lmv));
02336                         lmv->lmv_magic = LMV_MAGIC;
02337                         rc = lfsck_record_lmv(env, com, dir, lnr, lmv, stripe,
02338                                               LSLF_DANGLING, LSLF_NONE, &depth);
02339                 }
02340 
02341                 GOTO(out, rc);
02342         }
02343 
02344         stripe = lfsck_shard_name_to_index(env, lnr->lnr_name, lnr->lnr_namelen,
02345                                            lfsck_object_type(obj),
02346                                            &lnr->lnr_fid);
02347         if (stripe < 0) {
02348                 type = LNIT_BAD_DIRENT;
02349 
02350                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
02351         }
02352 
02353         rc = lfsck_read_stripe_lmv(env, obj, lmv);
02354         if (unlikely(rc == -ENOENT))
02355                 /* It may happen when the remote object has been removed,
02356                  * but the local MDT does not aware of that. */
02357                 goto dangling;
02358 
02359         if (rc == -ENODATA)
02360                 rc = lfsck_record_lmv(env, com, dir, lnr, lmv, stripe,
02361                                       LSLF_NO_LMVEA, LSLF_NONE, &depth);
02362         else if (rc == 0)
02363                 rc = lfsck_record_lmv(env, com, dir, lnr, lmv, stripe,
02364                                       lmv->lmv_master_mdt_index != stripe ?
02365                                       LSLF_BAD_INDEX1 : LSLF_NONE, LSLF_NONE,
02366                                       &depth);
02367 
02368         GOTO(out, rc);
02369 
02370 fail_lmv:
02371         llmv->ll_failed = 1;
02372 
02373 out:
02374         if (rc >= 0 && type == LNIT_NONE && !S_ISDIR(lnr->lnr_type))
02375                 type = LNIT_BAD_TYPE;
02376 
02377         switch (type) {
02378         case LNIT_BAD_TYPE:
02379                 rc = lfsck_namespace_repair_dirent(env, com, dir, obj,
02380                                                    lnr->lnr_name, lnr->lnr_name,
02381                                                    lnr->lnr_type, true, false);
02382                 if (rc > 0)
02383                         repaired = true;
02384                 break;
02385         case LNIT_BAD_DIRENT:
02386                 rc = lfsck_namespace_repair_dirent(env, com, dir, obj,
02387                                                    lnr->lnr_name, lnr->lnr_name,
02388                                                    lnr->lnr_type, false, false);
02389                 if (rc > 0)
02390                         repaired = true;
02391                 break;
02392         default:
02393                 break;
02394         }
02395 
02396         if (rc < 0) {
02397                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: namespace LFSCK assistant fail to handle "
02398                        "the shard: "DFID", parent "DFID", name %.*s: rc = %d\n",
02399                        lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), PFID(&lnr->lnr_fid),
02400                        PFID(pfid), lnr->lnr_namelen, lnr->lnr_name, rc);
02401 
02402                 if ((rc == -ENOTCONN || rc == -ESHUTDOWN || rc == -EREMCHG ||
02403                      rc == -ETIMEDOUT || rc == -EHOSTDOWN ||
02404                      rc == -EHOSTUNREACH || rc == -EINPROGRESS) &&
02405                     dev != NULL && dev != lfsck->li_bottom)
02406                         lfsck_lad_set_bitmap(env, com, shard_idx);
02407 
02408                 if (!(lfsck->li_bookmark_ram.lb_param & LPF_FAILOUT))
02409                         rc = 0;
02410         } else {
02411                 if (repaired) {
02412                         ns->ln_items_repaired++;
02413 
02414                         switch (type) {
02415                         case LNIT_BAD_TYPE:
02416                                 ns->ln_bad_type_repaired++;
02417                                 break;
02418                         case LNIT_BAD_DIRENT:
02419                                 ns->ln_dirent_repaired++;
02420                                 break;
02421                         default:
02422                                 break;
02423                         }
02424                 }
02425 
02426                 rc = 0;
02427         }
02428 
02429         if (obj != NULL && !IS_ERR(obj))
02430                 lfsck_object_put(env, obj);
02431 
02432         lfsck_object_put(env, dir);
02433 
02434         return rc;
02435 }
